messages.message:
Hi team,
I am collecting all opensource dependencies we use in our code for legal purposes. For frontend (/js) packages I am looking into this (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/package.json) package.json file for the dependencies. This package.json references to following  instabase’s own npm packages:
• @instabase.com/api
• @instabase.com/app-os-kit
• @instabase.com/pollen
• @instabase.com/doc-widget
Can someone point me to package.json’s for each of these. And also if we have js dependencies in any other package.json files, can someone point me to those.
cc @sudeep

Thanks!

@Jessica -- can you help answer this today? thank you. we basically need a list of libraries that are used in the frontend services, and check if the license is good to use. this is our regular compliance and legal process
And then Pollen lives here: https://github.com/instabase/pollen
You can also look at the yarn.lock file in the same directory as the package.json file to see what dependencies each package pulls in
Thanks! Also want to confirm does the package.json tagged above and these packages cover all js packages we use ?
Patch Professor, Cloud Console, and Deployment Manager each have their own package.jsons, but that one you linked to above is the only one for the core product
I think we need packages which are used by customer facing product. I think we might need to add DM as well @sudeep what do you think ?
yes @gurkirat we will need DM too
